attributes.action: Transport for London should suspend Congestion Charge for PHV for 3 months.
attributes.additional_details: The industry is already STRUGGLING to cope and a congestion charge to be on the road is not needed.  All PHV vehicles are low emissions with MOT done twice a year along with euro 6 diesel and petrol engines. TFL stop charging during Christmas period so why not now. The drivers are already finding it difficult to afford.
attributes.background: INSTRUCT TFL TO SUSPEND CHARGING TO ALREADY STRUGGLING PHV INDUSTRY AND IT WILL ASSIST DRIVERS TO OBTAIN WORK. DUE TO SCHOOLS CLOSED AND A REDUCED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES, VERY LESS POLLUTION IS IN THE CENTRAL LONDON CONGESTION ZONE AREA. IT WILL ASSIST FINANCIALLY TO THE PHV DRIVERS AND OPERATORS.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of the London Assembly.

Since you started this petition, TfL has suspended road charging schemes: https://tfl.gov.uk/info-for/media/press-releases/2020/march/tfl-suspends-all-road-user-charging-schemes-to-help-critical-workers?intcmp=62502

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
